com.berbils.game.Entities.ProjectileSpawners

Class SpokeProjectileSpawner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berbils.game.Entities.ProjectileSpawners.Weapon
      • com.berbils.game.Entities.ProjectileSpawners.SpokeProjectileSpawner

  • public class SpokeProjectileSpawner
extends Weapon
    This class is used to create projectile spawners that fire projectiles at set intervals every time an attack call is made

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private float increment
      The interval between each spawn point angle direction
      private int noOfSpawnPoints
      The number of spokes or points at which a projectile will spawn per attack call
      private float startPos
      The angle which the projectiles will start creating intervals from Stores how far round the circle the projectiles will spawn
      private float startPosIncrement
      The angle that the spawner will move by each time an attack call is made, increasing it would increase the distance between the projecties of two attack calls

      • Fields inherited from class com.berbils.game.Entities.ProjectileSpawners.Weapon

        fireDelay, projectileType, startTime

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpokeProjectileSpawner(double fireRatePerSecond, Projectiles projectileType, int noOfSpawnPoints)
      Instantiates variables required, including startPos, the increment and startPosIncrement

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void attack(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 spawnPos, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 targetPos)
      Spawns a set number of projectiles in a spoke pattern, the number of spokes being depdendant upon pre-defined variables.Then increments the spawn position so the spokes shift slightly round in a circle, spawning at a slightly different point next attack call.Also updates the last time a projectile was spawned to limit fire rate.
      private void defineStats(int noOfSpawnPoints)
      Calculates and assigns the startPosIncrement and increment, also assigns the number of spawn points

      • Methods inherited from class com.berbils.game.Entities.ProjectileSpawners.Weapon

        canFire, getTargetDir, setFixtureCategory, setLinearVelocity, spawnProjectile

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • startPosIncrement

        private float startPosIncrement
        The angle that the spawner will move by each time an attack call is made, increasing it would increase the distance between the projecties of two attack calls

      • increment

        private float increment
        The interval between each spawn point angle direction

      • startPos

        private float startPos
        The angle which the projectiles will start creating intervals from Stores how far round the circle the projectiles will spawn

      • noOfSpawnPoints

        private int noOfSpawnPoints
        The number of spokes or points at which a projectile will spawn per attack call

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpokeProjectileSpawner

        public SpokeProjectileSpawner(double fireRatePerSecond,
                              Projectiles projectileType,
                              int noOfSpawnPoints)
        Instantiates variables required, including startPos, the increment and startPosIncrement
        Parameters:
        fireRatePerSecond - The number of attack calls per second
        projectileType - The projectile type that will be spawned
        noOfSpawnPoints - The number of spokes or points at which a projectile will spawn per attack call

    • Method Detail

      • defineStats

        private void defineStats(int noOfSpawnPoints)
        Calculates and assigns the startPosIncrement and increment, also assigns the number of spawn points
        Parameters:
        noOfSpawnPoints - The number of spokes or points at which a projectile will spawn per attack call

      • attack

        public void attack(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 spawnPos,
                   com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 targetPos)
        Spawns a set number of projectiles in a spoke pattern, the number of spokes being depdendant upon pre-defined variables.Then increments the spawn position so the spokes shift slightly round in a circle, spawning at a slightly different point next attack call.Also updates the last time a projectile was spawned to limit fire rate.
        Specified by:
        attack in class Weapon
        Parameters:
        spawnPos - The position the projectile will be spawned from in meters
        targetPos - The target position the projectile will be launched towards in meters, Note- This is redundant in this method
